scorings.justification: The text clearly states that the processing-extension certificate expired on 11 October 2024, indicating the need for a new certificate.
Mr C explicitly expresses his desire to submit an asylum application in the text.
There is no request or inquiry about the status of a pending asylum application as this is his first application.
The text does not mention the expiration of an ATDA.
There is no mention of updating ATDA information.
No reference is made to an ongoing Dublin procedure.
There are no requests for a new residence permit from a Ukrainian national in the text.
There are no requests for renewal of a residence permit from a Ukrainian national in the text.
No mention is made of an 'other' request from a Ukrainian national.
The text does not involve a student in a mobility programme.
There is no mention of a trainee attached to the medical profession.
The text does not present any difficulties relating to the ANEF website.
No request for a change of status from student to salaried employee is described.
No request for a change of status from student to job seeker is described.
Mr C is not applying for a 'private and family life' residence permit outside the ANEF portal.
The request does not mention issues with creating an ANEF account.
No mention is made of an application ordeal related to the ANEF site.
There are no other ANEF-related problems mentioned.
Mr C wishes to travel to his home country for the exceptional reason of attending his father's funeral, indicating intent for return for an exceptional motive.

Without action in the next few days, he risks losing his job.
He currently holds subsidiary protection status
